column4: guys my res a 640x480 and will not let me change it how to fix it ?
what video card do you have?
you need to install the nvidia driver
no
do 'glxinfo | grep direct' for me please
step 1. relax man :)
good
do 'sudo /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.bak
do 'sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.bak'
no errors?
good, now do: gksudo gedit xorg.conf

before we edit the file, in case it doesn't work, you will have to use the console to go the the /etc/X11 directory and move the backup file to the original place (sudo cp xorg.conf.backup xorg.conf) write this down if you need to
the use sudo instead of gksudo
good, now do: sudo gedit xorg.conf
did you use the desktop install or what?
scroll all the way down
just before the very bottom, there is a section with resolutions and such
now what
what resolution do you want?
if not, try restarting the X server (Ctrl+Alt+Backspace) and then you should be able to get the resolution you want
made sure you had the resolution you wanted for X to use and made a backup of the config file :)
